Posts.Content: Jun 18, 2009 08:11PM teelee wrote: pzastrow, I can certainly understand where you're coming from. My mom was diagnoses with endometrial cancer and had surgery in Dec./08. I was diagnosed with bc in Feb/09 and had my surgery Mar.24/09. I also had a hysterectomy a number of years ago (still have my ovaries). I know cancer is a scary thing to go through, just keep positive!! MamaLambNC, IDC & DCIS me too. Yes there is lot's to think about. Only you can decide what is best for you. I chose to have a lumpectomy and radiation. I was leaning towards a mastectomy until my doctor was unwilling to remove both breasts. Luckily my HER2 was negative and chemo was not required in my case. I am now in week 3 of radiation, it's not that bad....better then the alternative! I found that knowledge was power. So be informed, know what they're talking about. I understand that you're scared, I think a person would have to be crazy not to be!! Just be grateful you live in this generation where they are well equipped to treat us, 20 years ago they weren't as fortunate. It will be okay, vent if you have to. People here on this site all understand. Take care
